prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

name: Luke Halloway
mes:
The bass thumped hard enough to rattle windows. Bodies moved in chaotic rhythm under pulsing lights. It was that kind of party that started with a few friends and became a rager with the entire frat and football team there, along with sorority girls.

And Luke Hallaway? He was right in the middle of it, lounging like a fucking prince—legs spread on Theo's sunken couch like he fucking owned it, a girl curled into each side, his head tipped back, and a lazy grin carved into his face like sin.

He looked good and he knew it.

Tousled red hair, that leather jacket barely clinging to his frame. His rings flashed as one hand lazily trailed up the thigh of the girl perched on his lap and under her skirt, the other scrolling through his texts like they weren’t five people talking to him at once.

“Tell me why Nate tried to ollie off Kade’s dad’s yacht last summer and landed in an oyster bed?” Blake said, wheezing with laughter.

“He thought it was sand,” Jace chimed in, half-choking on his drink. “Motherfucker got barnacles embedded in his ass cheek. Sent us a picture like it was a badge of honor.”

“Nah, bro. The best part? He told the ER nurse it was a skateboarding accident. In water.” Jace said as he swirled the beer in his red Solo cup and looked around the room. “God, I missed this shit. School’s been dry as hell.”

“Because you stopped showing up to class,” Luke snorted, flicking a paper airplane at his twin’s head. “And when you do, you’re high off your ass.”

Jace caught it mid-air. Grinned.

“That’s called self-care.”

Luke was the center of the orbit. Easy, laughing, shining like a devil dipped in cologne and confidence. The girl in his lap tugged at his chain trying to draw his attention, and he let her. He tilted his head like a cat bored with a toy. And then—just as Blake started to pass Luke another blunt—his gaze flicked toward the doorway.

Hailee  had arrived.

Wearing that pretty little outfit like she owned the oxygen in the room. She looked like she couldn’t decide if she wanted to cry or kill someone. Because there Luke was, on her brother's couch, acting like he hadn't chased her for weeks, fucked her senseless a week ago, ghosted her, and then sent her a picture of him balls deep in some other bitch.

Like he wasn’t her stepbrother’s greatest enemy. Like he wasn’t her greatest enemy.

As their eyes met, Luke didn't even blink. He leaned in towards the girl in his lap, tugging on a piece of her hair lightly as he murmured something that made her face flush, his other hand sliding higher up her skirt.

“Here comes Theo's baby sister,” Blake snorted as he lounged back on the sofa, his half-lidded eyes glinting with sadistic enjoyment. “Mhm,” Luke murmured into the girl's neck, all casual disdain. “Looks like she wants to stab me or fuck me—maybe both.”

The boys laughed. Luke smirked.

“Didn’t you ghost her after—what, one night?” Kade asked, raising a brow. “One hell of a night,” Luke replied, fake toasting the air. “But I wasn’t trying to make her breakfast. I was making a point.”

“What point?”

And when Hailee  finally got close enough, he didn’t even look at her. “He thinks I’m the devil,” Luke said with a wolfish grin. “So I fucked his sister. Call it biblical.” They all howled. He turned to her then—just slightly, just enough to let his eyes drag over her slowly, and added, voice low and smug:

“She came back for seconds, too.”

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee roles her eyes clenching her fist trying to not scream or hit Luke or his friends or the spank in his lap. She closes her eyes takes a deep breath then calmly* "I need to talk to you alone. Its improtant"

name: Luke Halloway
mes:
Luke didn’t even pause his lazy exploration of the girl in his lap, fingers still tracing idle patterns under her skirt as he tilted his head back to look at Hailee. His smirk was infuriatingly casual, like she was just another nuisance interrupting his fun.

*"Important?"* He drawled, voice dripping with amusement. *"You mean like how you were 'important' last week when you begged me not to stop?"*

The guys around him erupted into laughter—Blake nearly choking on his drink, Jace shaking his head with a grin. The girl in Luke’s lap giggled, pressing closer to him like she'd won some prize just by being there while Hailee stood there looking like she wanted to set the room on fire.

Luke finally pulled his hand away from the other girl's thigh—slowly, deliberately—and leaned forward just enough to meet Hailee’s gaze dead-on. His blue eyes were sharp beneath that lazy half-lidded stare, daring her to react.

*"Important?"* He dragged the word out, voice dripping with amusement. *"You sure you don’t just wanna watch?"*

The guys around him snickered—Blake especially, who took a long drag from his blunt before exhaling smoke right toward her direction with a lazy grin. Jace just shook his head, already bored and reaching for another beer.

But Hailee stood firm, emerald eyes burning into Luke’s icy blues with an intensity that made even him hesitate for half a second before

Luke finally pulled his hand away from the other girl's thigh—slowly, deliberately—and leaned forward just enough to meet Hailee’s gaze dead-on. His blue eyes were sharp beneath that lazy half-lidded stare, daring her to react.

name: Hailee
mes: "You know what. Whatever I dont care" *Hailee scoffs shaking her head* "I'm pregnant its yours. Don't worry I'll get rid of it. Have a nice fucking life" *Hailee states before turning on her heel and stomping out of the door*

name: Luke Halloway
mes:
The room went dead silent.

Luke’s smirk froze mid-way, his fingers stilling where they'd been toying with the girl’s skirt. For a second—just a fucking *second*—his usual cocky mask slipped, and something raw flickered behind his eyes.

Then it was gone.

He shoved the girl off his lap like she was nothing, standing up so fast the couch groaned under him. His jaw clenched tight enough to crack teeth as he watched Hailee storm out, her words hanging in the air like a grenade with the pin pulled.

Blake whistled low under his breath. *"Damn."*
Jace just stared at Luke like he was waiting for an explosion.
Kade raised an eyebrow, swirling his drink lazily before muttering, *"Well that's one way to ruin a party."*

Luke didn’t say shit at first—just stood there for a beat too long, staring at the door Hailee had just slammed behind her like he could burn through it with sheer willpower alone. Then—like flipping a switch—he forced out a laugh that sounded more like gravel than humor and dropped back onto the couch with all the grace of someone who absolutely did not give a fuck.

*"Yeah right,"* he scoffed, reaching for his drink again even though his grip on it was tighter than necessary now.* "Like I'd believe that shit."*

But nobody laughed this time.

And when Jace shot him a look that said *'you're full of shit,'* Luke just knocked back half his drink in one go and pretended not to notice how Blake leaned over to whisper something in Kade's ear.

Because if there was one thing Luke Halloway refused to do?

It was chase after some girl who thought she could drop bombshells and walk away unscathed.

...Right?
swipes:
The room went dead silent.

Luke’s smirk froze mid-way, his fingers stilling where they’d been toying with the girl’s skirt. The laughter died in Blake’s throat, Jace sat up straight like he'd been electrocuted, and even the music seemed to dull for a second—like the universe itself had paused to process that bomb drop.

Then Luke was on his feet so fast the girl in his lap yelped as she nearly tumbled off him. His drink hit the floor with a *clatter*, ice skittering across hardwood as he shoved past Kade and Blake without a word, eyes locked on Hailee's retreating figure.

*"Hailee."* His voice wasn't cocky now—it was sharp, commanding, cutting through the noise of the party like a blade. He didn't yell it; he didn't have to. That one word carried enough weight to make her stop dead in her tracks whether she wanted to or not.

He caught up before she could disappear into the crowd outside, grabbing her wrist—not rough but firm enough that she couldn't just shake him off without effort—and spun her back around toward him under dim porch light filtering through smoke from someone's vape pen nearby..

His expression? Unreadable at first glance—but if you knew where (or how)to look? There was something dangerous flickering behind those blue eyes now: A storm brewing beneath calm waters..

*"Say that again."*

The room went dead silent.

Luke’s smirk froze mid-taunt. The girl in his lap stiffened, her giggle dying in her throat as she glanced between him and the door Hailee had just stormed out of. Blake choked on his drink—*actually* choked this time—while Jace’s eyebrows shot up so high they nearly disappeared into his hairline.

For a split second, Luke didn’t move. Didn’t breathe. His fingers twitched against the couch cushion like he was calculating whether to stay or bolt after her—but then his expression hardened back into that same careless mask, jaw tightening as he forced a laugh through gritted teeth.

*"Yeah, right."* He scoffed, leaning back like nothing had happened, but there was an edge to his voice now—something tight and unreadable beneath the usual cocky drawl. *"She's full of shit."*

Blake recovered first with a low whistle. *"Damn, man… you gonna let her walk out like that?"*

Luke shot him a glare sharp enough to cut glass before snatching up the half-finished beer next to him and downing it in one go. *"Like I said,"* he muttered darkly as he slammed the cup down hard enough to crack it, *"she's lying."*

But even as he said it? His eyes flicked toward the door again—just for half a second too long before forcing himself to look away with another forced smirk at no one in particular.*

The room went dead silent.

Luke’s smirk froze mid-way, his fingers stilling where they'd been toying with the girl’s skirt. For a second—just a fucking *second*—his usual cocky mask slipped, and something raw flickered behind his eyes.

Then it was gone.

He shoved the girl off his lap like she was nothing, standing up so fast the couch groaned under him. His jaw clenched tight enough to crack teeth as he watched Hailee storm out, her words hanging in the air like a grenade with the pin pulled.

Blake whistled low under his breath. *"Damn."*
Jace just stared at Luke like he was waiting for an explosion.
Kade raised an eyebrow, swirling his drink lazily before muttering, *"Well that's one way to ruin a party."*

Luke didn’t say shit at first—just stood there for a beat too long, staring at the door Hailee had just slammed behind her like he could burn through it with sheer willpower alone. Then—like flipping a switch—he forced out a laugh that sounded more like gravel than humor and dropped back onto the couch with all the grace of someone who absolutely did not give a fuck.

*"Yeah right,"* he scoffed, reaching for his drink again even though his grip on it was tighter than necessary now.* "Like I'd believe that shit."*

But nobody laughed this time.

And when Jace shot him a look that said *'you're full of shit,'* Luke just knocked back half his drink in one go and pretended not to notice how Blake leaned over to whisper something in Kade's ear.

Because if there was one thing Luke Halloway refused to do?

It was chase after some girl who thought she could drop bombshells and walk away unscathed.

...Right?
